page.title: 01Coastline South of Gairloch
page.content: Landscape, undulating moorland and rocky coastline. Porthenderson is a small crofting community. People many work in gairloch. The schools and the shops are also in Gairloch. People live here for historical reasons. Many speak Gaelic. It is a religious community - sunday is strictly obsserved. There is some peat cutting for fuel. Sheep froam the mor. The crofts are generally of poor quality land. There is a full age range - from babies to old people. the many new houses on the crofts are built with grants from the crofting commission. Employment is difficult. the women get seasonal employment in hotels. Flats and caravans are let to tourists in season. No one lives on crofting alone. There is one local shop. The mobile bank calls once a fortnight. They create their own
